name: Building Regulations – drivers of change?
location: This stream will take place in (room to be confirmed)
description: Building Regulations are a recognised instrument for achieving performance targets and have delivered improved standards over the years. The anticipated changes to Part L  expected in 2013 (and beyond) appear to be the most challenging  in terms of energy and carbon standards for both new build and refurbished buildings. This seminar will explore a series of questions - How will any revisions to Part L be delivered and overseen? What are the implications for costs? What are the implications of the consultation on the Future of Building Control?

presentations.name: An overview of where we are now and where we are going
presentations.speakers: Barry Turner, Director of Technical Policy, LABC

presentations.name: 2013 Part L - an introduction to the changes - Outline of the planned changes and the impact of these for domestic, non domestic and refurbishment
presentations.speakers: Paul DeCourt, Technical Policy Officer, DCLG

presentations.name: Beyond 2013 - What will be the most cost effective way of complying with Part L and what further carbon reductions are possible using onsite solutions?
presentations.speakers: Adam Mactavish, Director of Sustainability, Cyril Sweett
